text: Soccer City is a sports stadium in Johannesburg, South Africa. It was first built in 1987. At that time, it was named the FNB Stadium. == Renovation == In 2009, the stadium was improved. More seats were added. New locker (dressing) rooms and new floodlights were built. == FIFA World Cup == The stadium co- hosted the 2010 FIFA World Cup. It is one of the 10 stadiums where World Cup matches were played. 2010 World Cup Matches All times are given in South African Standard time (UTC+2). When South Africa's most popular soccer team, the [Kaizer Chiefs] play in the stadium, they attract approximately 15,000 fans, during rival soccer matches and derbies they attract approximately more than 75 000 fans when they play there among the rotating venues that they use. == References == == Other websites == * Official Soccer City Site * Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA) Category:FIFA World Cup Category:Football stadiums in South Africa Category:Buildings and structures in Johannesburg Category:1987 establishments in Africa Category:1980s establishments in South Africa
